# entityName

**Instance Property**

The name of the entity the request is configured to fetch.

## Declaration

```swift
var entityName: String? { get }
```

## Discussion

The entity name property is populated whenever the NSFetchRequest is created with [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchRequest/init(entityName:)] or [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchRequest/fetchRequestWithEntityName:].

## Managing the Fetch Request’s Entity

- **init()**: Creates a new fetch request.
- **init(entityName:)**: Initializes a fetch request configured with a given entity name.
- **entity**: The entity specified for the fetch request.
- **includesSubentities**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the fetch request includes subentities in the results.
- **NSFetchRequestResultType**: Constants that specify the possible result types a fetch request can return.
